author: potuz
content: Hello, do we have numbers on how long it takes single bit attestations to propagate across the network to a specific node? the number I want is this: I am a single node, well connected and with good resources and I'm listening on all subnets. Attesters submitted their attestations at 4 seconds. When do I expect to have seen 50% of attestations already?

author: potuz

author: potuz
content: I'm really hoping this is less than a second now

author: arnetheduck
content: it's certainly far below a second but there's no trivial way to measure this - you'd have to create a setup with well-spread sentry nodes and measure it which was done for blocks but not for attestations afaik - https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/3433 - that said, the first graph in that issue gives you a hint - _almost all_ attestations arrive in the tight space around 4s - many of them arrive earlier (from clients that implement the "send-when-block-is-seen" rule such as nimbus - we do it with a 1s delay however, so the earliest we _start_ sending is 1s after block time - the fact that a lot of attestations arrive before 2s lets us deduce that it certainly takes less than a second for a lot of attestations

author: arnetheduck
content: the problem is that the graph has a lot of noise that would have to be eliminated to say for certain, ie we don't know when those attestations _start_ being sent, only when they arrive - their send time, we have to guess / deduce

author: arnetheduck
content: I think the biggest problem with attestations is that the clients that only do the send-at-4s-rule cause a stampede where suddently we have to validate a lot of attestations in a burst, rather than spread out a bit
